decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering or bouncing opponent's threats with cards like Remand and Cryptic Command, while also disrupting their board with Anger of the Gods and Electrolyze. The deck's win condition revolves around getting Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and multiple Mountain lands out, then casting Scapeshift to deal lethal damage to the opponent. The deck also includes card draw spells like Anticipate and Izzet Charm to find the necessary pieces for the combo and maintain card advantage.

The primary focus of this deck is to enable a powerful combo involving the cards Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace or Phyrexian Unlife. By using these cards in combination with cards like Pact of Negation and Spoils of the Vault, the deck aims to set up a situation where the player can draw their entire deck, play Laboratory Maniac, and win the game on the spot. The deck also includes various mana ramp cards and filtering effects to help find the combo pieces quickly and efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build up a powerful, hexproofed creature using auras like Rancor, Ethereal Armor, and Daybreak Coronet. The key strategy is to protect that creature with additional auras like Spider Umbra and Hyena Umbra, making it difficult for opponents to target or remove it. The inclusion of cards like Slippery Bogle and Gladecover Scout ensure a consistent source of hexproof creatures, while cards like Kor Spiritdancer and Gaddock Teeg provide additional utility and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast, resilient threat that can quickly win the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using counterspells and removal while ramping up mana to eventually cast Scapeshift. The deck includes various versatile spells like Cryptic Command and Izzet Charm, as well as ramp spells like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow. The win condition is to resolve Scapeshift and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with enough mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one turn. The deck aims to delay the opponent's strategy and disrupt their game plan until it can execute its own combo.

The main focus of this Jund deck is to quickly disrupt your opponent's hand and board while deploying efficient threats to close out the game. Utilizing powerful disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, alongside versatile removal like Terminate and Abrupt Decay, the deck aims to control the game through hand disruption and removal while applying pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil. The deck's versatility is further enhanced by its ability to generate card advantage with cards like Dark Confidant and Kolaghan's Command.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful combinations and synergies. It utilizes cards like Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures, such as Kiki-Jiki, Mirror Breaker and Restoration Angel, to generate infinite combos. The toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility in adapting to different situations and opponents, with cards like Path to Exile and Qasali Pridemage providing removal and disruption. The deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo win conditions.

This Modern Aggro Merfolk deck focuses on utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to boost the power and toughness of all Merfolk creatures. With efficient creatures like Silvergill Adept and Merrow Reejerey, as well as disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Spreading Seas, the deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures. By using Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disruptive elements like Cursecatcher and Harbinger of the Tides, the deck can disrupt the opponent's strategy while building its own aggressive board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and removal, while gradually drawing cards and gaining card advantage with cards like Ancestral Vision and Snapcaster Mage. The deck aims to maintain control of the board until it can finish the game with powerful threats like Celestial Colonnade. The mana base is carefully constructed to provide the necessary colors to cast spells efficiently. Overall, the deck focuses on controlling the game and outvaluing the opponent with efficient spells.

This combo deck focuses on quickly assembling the Ad Nauseam combo by using cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism to generate mana, while also using Phyrexian Unlife to stay alive. By casting Ad Nauseam with Angel's Grace to prevent losing the game from drawing too many cards, the deck can then use Lightning Storm to deal lethal damage to the opponent. Pact of Negation provides protection to ensure the combo resolves, while cards like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions help dig for key pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through a combination of mana-producing Elves and Heritage Druid, to then utilize that mana to cast key Elves like Shaman of the Pack and Ezuri, Renegade Leader. Collected Company and Chord of Calling help search for these key Elves and combo pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a large board presence of Elves and drain their life total with Shaman of the Pack's ability. The lands and creatures are specifically chosen to maximize mana production and ensure the combo pieces can be reliably cast.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control spells and creatures to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. It utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate, along with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Snapcaster Mage to generate value and further control the game. With a mix of control spells, creatures, and card draw, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a long game.

The deck focuses on quickly getting powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn onto the battlefield using cards like Through the Breach and Goryo's Vengeance. It utilizes instant spells like Lightning Bolt and Izzet Charm for control and protection while also having card draw and selection with Serum Visions, Sleight of Hand, and Faithless Looting. The mana base includes fetch lands and shock lands for consistency and flexibility. The goal is to combo off and reanimate game-winning threats in a fast and efficient manner.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by using powerful creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and keep the opponent on the back foot. It leverages cards like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to apply early pressure while using Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The creature removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Terminate help to clear the way for its creatures to keep attacking. The overall strategy is to maintain board control and pressure the opponent into making suboptimal plays.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells to apply pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. It aims to control the board with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while also generating card advantage with Dark Confidant and Liliana of the Veil. The creatures, like Tarmogoyf and Huntmaster of the Fells, are resilient threats that can quickly end the game if left unchecked. The deck also has the flexibility to adapt to different game situations with a versatile removal package and interactive spells like Kolaghan's Command.

The deck focuses on using efficient creatures and disruption spells to pressure the opponent's life total while disrupting their game plan. It utilizes powerful cards like Tarmogoyf and Liliana of the Veil to control the board and maintain pressure. The deck also includes removal spells like Terminate and Lightning Bolt to deal with threats quickly. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while overwhelming them with aggressive creatures, ultimately leading to a win through a combination of combat damage and card advantage.

This Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. With low mana costs and high damage output, it aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. The key strategy is to maintain a fast-paced tempo, consistently dealing damage and preventing the opponent from gaining life or stabilizing their board. The deck prioritizes direct damage spells and creatures with haste to apply pressure and force the opponent to react quickly.
